summary: Jerome A. Cullings was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents list his name, position, and salary during his time with the committee. The documents indicate that he was employed by the HSCA for at least a year, from late 1977 to late 1978.
significance: Jerome A. Cullings' significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with reinvestigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the committee's payroll indicates his involvement in the investigation, contributing to the overall effort to understand the events surrounding the assassination.
